attributes.description: MV ZIP challenge: Understand how MV_ZIP and CONCAT works to combine arrays and reveal the flag.

kibanaSavedObjectMeta.searchSourceJSON:
{"query":{"esql":"ROW a1 = ["c","f"], a2 = ["t"], b1 =["p", "a", "y"], b2 = ["e", "s"], c1 = ["s", "i", "p"], c2 = ["k", "p","y"], d1 = ["e", "s"], d2 =["a","y"], e1 = ["z", "p", "y"], e2 = ["i", "p"]
| EVAL a12 = MV_CONCAT(MV_ZIP(a1, a2, "r"),"e")
| EVAL b12 = MV_CONCAT(MV_ZIP(b1, b2, "e"),"")
| EVAL c12 = MV_CONCAT(MV_ZIP(c1, c2, "m"),"m")
| EVAL d12 = MV_CONCAT(MV_ZIP(d1, d2, "o"),"e")
| EVAL e12 = MV_CONCAT(MV_ZIP(e1, e2, "v"),"!")
| EVAL parta = MV_APPEND(a12, b12), parta = MV_APPEND(parta, c12), partb = MV_APPEND(d12, e12)
| EVAL partab = MV_ZIP(parta, partb, "_")
| EVAL allparts = MV_CONCAT(partab, "_")
| EVAL flagme = CONCAT("{",allparts,"}")
| KEEP a12, b12, c12, d12, e12, parta, partb, partab, allparts, flagme"},"index":{"id":"845c6caef1a32b0a9a91c1d366ee9a644754421e1004a6b7179fdbadec09ca82","title":"","sourceFilters":[],"type":"esql","fieldFormats":{},"runtimeFieldMap":{},"allowNoIndex":false,"name":"","allowHidden":false},"filter":[]}

attributes.title: ES|QL - MV ZIP Madness
